name: syllable

B2 a single unit of speech, either a whole word or one of the parts into which a word can be separated, usually containing a vowel
Examples
In the word 'engine', you should stress the first syllable.The word 'button' has two syllables.

Add to word list
Add to word list
a single unit of speech, in English usually containing a vowel, consisting of either a whole word or one of the parts into which a word is separated when it is spoken or printed: There are two syllables in the word silver and three in appetite.
